Mining Tax Framework:

Royalties:
- Critical component of DRC mining tax framework
- Paid based on gross commercial value of minerals extracted
- Payable regardless of mine profitability
- Royalty base: Market value at point of sale, not cost of production
- Payments distributed: Central government, provincial authorities, local communities
- Strategic minerals (2018 amendments): 10% royalty due to global economic significance

Tax Incentives:
- 10-year stability guarantee for fiscal terms
- 2018 Mining Code: Narrowed from 10 years after exploitation begins to 10 years after license issuance

Preferential Features:
- Absence (under conditions) of WHT on interest for foreign currency loans concluded abroad
- Reduced 10% WHT rate for dividends
- Exceptional tax for expatriates' remuneration: 12.5% for first 10 years, 25% thereafter

Exploration Phase Benefits:
- Exemption from import duties and VAT on equipment, vehicles, consumables used exclusively for exploration
- Simplified customs clearance procedures

Production Phase Benefits:
- Reduced import duties on production equipment
- VAT suspension for materials used in mining production (subject to authorization)
- Accelerated depreciation for capital investment in mining infrastructure

Repatriation Requirements:
- Mining companies may repatriate up to 60% of export proceeds
- Remaining 40% must be retained in DRC for local banking liquidity

Community Development:
2018 Mining Code: 0.3% of turnover to social development projects in operating areas.
